content:
Diagnosis:	Prostate adenocarcinoma, left apex

Staging:		T2aN0M0, Gleason 3+4=7

Biomarkers:	PSA at diagnosis 5.1ng/ml (March 2024)
		BRIP1 mutation positive

Treatment:	Commenced radical external beam radiotherapy 74Gy in 37# on 15 April 2024

Current Status:	Week 4 of radiotherapy treatment

[redacted name] is tolerating his radical radiotherapy well at the four-week mark. He reports mild urinary frequency and nocturia twice nightly, managed with good fluid balance. No significant bowel symptoms. His urinary stream remains good with no hesitancy. Performance status remains 0.

On examination today, there are no concerning features. Digital rectal examination shows expected radiotherapy-related changes only.

Latest PSA has decreased to 3.2ng/ml (15 May 2024). He will complete his planned course of radiotherapy next week. We will arrange follow-up PSA testing in 6 weeks and review in clinic with results. He understands to contact the radiotherapy department if he develops any new symptoms in the meantime.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: PSA 5.1ng/ml at diagnosis, BRIP1 mutation positive

cancer_timeline.value: Started radical external beam radiotherapy 74Gy in 37 fractions

patient_facts.value: Mild urinary frequency and nocturia twice nightly
Digital rectal examination shows expected radiotherapy-related changes only

status_updates.value: Localized prostate cancer undergoing radical radiotherapy. Good treatment tolerance at week 4 with expected mild urinary symptoms
Mild urinary frequency and nocturia, no significant bowel symptoms
Continuing with planned radiotherapy course, due to complete next week
Review in clinic with PSA results in 6 weeks
